title: Sheaf House (stadium)
text:
Sheaf House is a former home ground of <a href="Sheffield%20Wednesday%20F.C.">The Wednesday Football Club</a> and was located near the centre of <a href="Sheffield">Sheffield</a>, <a href="South%20Yorkshire">South Yorkshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. The club started to use the ground after leaving <a href="Myrtle%20Road">Myrtle Road</a> in 1877 and it remained their main 'home' ground until 1880. At that point most home matches switched to <a href="Bramall%20Lane">Bramall Lane</a>, however Wednesday continued to play some games at Sheaf House until <a href="Olive%20Grove">Olive Grove</a> was opened in 1887.
Sheaf House was less suitable for hosting <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches than Bramall Lane (which was situated very close to the ground) but it was apparently cheaper to rent.
The ground has since been covered by a new development, however the Sheaf House <a href="public%20house">pub</a> which used to stand at the corner of the ground is still there.
